meanings.definition: The rise and fall of the voice in speaking.
meanings.sent1: Her intonations showed excitement as she told the story.
meanings.sent2: His intonations made it clear he was asking a question.
meanings.sent3: The robot's intonations were so monotone that it sounded like a machine.
meanings.sent4: The intonations of the wind through the trees created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: I could tell she was upset from the intonations of her voice.

meanings.definition: The manner of producing musical tones.
meanings.sent1: The singer's intonations were flawless during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The intonations of the violin added depth to the music.
meanings.sent3: The intonations of the piano keys filled the room with beautiful music.
meanings.sent4: His intonations on the guitar were so skillful that it mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The intonations of the flute echoed through the concert hall.

meanings.definition: The modulation of the voice in singing.
meanings.sent1: Her intonations while singing were captivating.
meanings.sent2: The intonations of the choir blended harmoniously.
meanings.sent3: The parrot mimicked the intonations of the opera singer hilariously.
meanings.sent4: His intonations on stage were like a symphony of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The intonations of the soloist brought tears to the audience's eyes.
